name: Front Kick (Mae Geri)
description: A fundamental forward kick executed with the ball of the foot, targeting the opponent's midsection. This is one of the most basic techniques in Karate.

name: Roundhouse Kick (Mawashi Geri)
description: A circular kick that strikes with the instep or shin, one of the most powerful kicks in martial arts. Commonly used in Karate and Kickboxing.

name: Side Kick (Yoko Geri)
description: A powerful kick delivered sideways with the heel or edge of the foot, used for keeping distance and generating power.

name: Back Kick (Ushiro Geri)
description: A rear kick executed by thrusting the heel backwards, delivering powerful force to targets behind the practitioner.

name: Spinning Back Kick
description: A more powerful version of the back kick where the practitioner spins 180-360 degrees before executing the kick.

name: Hook Kick
description: A deceptive kick that appears to miss before snapping back to hit with the heel, requiring good flexibility and control.

name: Spinning Hook Kick
description: A spinning variation of the hook kick, also known as the spinning whip kick, used for powerful head-level strikes.

name: Axe Kick
description: A downward striking kick where the leg is raised high and brought down on the target like an axe, hitting with the heel.

name: Crescent Kick
description: A circular kick that sweeps across the body in an arc, often used for warm-ups and flexibility training.

name: Low Kick
description: A kick aimed at targets below the waist, typically the thigh or calf, used extensively in Muay Thai and MMA.

name: Teep (Push Kick)
description: A forward pushing kick using the ball of the foot, used to create distance and off-balance opponents in Muay Thai.

name: Flying Knee
description: An explosive jumping knee strike aimed at the opponent's head or body, commonly used in Muay Thai and MMA.

name: Jab
description: A quick, straight punch thrown with the lead hand, used for measuring distance, setting up combinations, and scoring points.

name: Cross
description: A powerful straight punch thrown with the rear hand, one of the most damaging punches in boxing when properly executed.

name: Hook
description: A semi-circular punch thrown with either hand, targeting the side of the opponent's head or body.

name: Uppercut
description: An upward punch thrown from a crouched position, targeting the opponent's chin or solar plexus.

name: Jab-Cross Combination
description: The most basic boxing combination: a lead jab followed immediately by a rear cross, fundamental for all boxers.

name: Elbow Strike
description: A close-range strike using the point of the elbow, devastating in clinch situations and Muay Thai.

name: Rising Block (Age Uke)
description: An upward block used to defend against overhead attacks, raising the forearm to deflect the strike.

name: Middle Block (Uchi Uke)
description: An inside block that deflects attacks to the midsection using a sweeping forearm motion.

name: Lower Block (Gedan Barai)
description: A downward sweeping block used to defend against low attacks to the legs or midsection.

name: Hip Throw (O Goshi)
description: A fundamental Judo throw using hip rotation to lift and throw the opponent over the hip.

name: Shoulder Throw (Seoi Nage)
description: A classic Judo throw where you pull the opponent over your shoulder using arm and hip movement.

name: Foot Sweep (De Ashi Barai)
description: A technique that sweeps the opponent's foot as they step, causing them to lose balance and fall.

name: Armbar (Juji Gatame)
description: A joint lock submission technique that hyperextends the opponent's elbow, used in Judo and BJJ.

name: Rear Naked Choke
description: A chokehold applied from behind the opponent, cutting off blood flow to the brain using the forearm.

name: Triangle Choke (Sankaku Jime)
description: A submission using the legs to form a triangle around the opponent's neck and arm, restricting blood flow.

name: Guillotine Choke
description: A front choke where you wrap your arm around the opponent's neck and squeeze, commonly used in MMA.

name: Guard Position
description: A ground fighting position where the practitioner is on their back with legs wrapped around the opponent.

name: Mount Position
description: A dominant ground position where you sit on top of the opponent's torso, controlling them with your weight.

name: Double Leg Takedown
description: A wrestling technique where you grab both of the opponent's legs and drive forward to take them to the ground.

name: Single Leg Takedown
description: A takedown where you grab one of the opponent's legs and use various techniques to bring them down.

name: Superman Punch
description: A deceptive strike where you fake a kick, jump forward, and throw a punch while in the air.

name: Spinning Backfist
description: A spinning strike using the back of the fist to hit the opponent, requiring good timing and distance control.

name: Palm Strike
description: A strike using the heel of the palm instead of a closed fist, safer for the hand and effective in self-defense.

name: Knee Strike
description: A powerful strike using the knee, devastating at close range especially to the midsection or head.

name: Clinch
description: A standing grappling position where fighters control each other, used extensively in Muay Thai and MMA.

name: Sprawl
description: A defensive technique used to counter takedown attempts by throwing your legs back and driving your weight down.

name: Kimura Lock
description: A shoulder lock submission that rotates the arm behind the back, named after Japanese judoka Masahiko Kimura.

name: Omoplata
description: A shoulder lock where you use your legs to control and submit the opponent by rotating their shoulder.

name: Ankle Lock
description: A submission technique that hyperextends the ankle joint, commonly used in MMA and submission grappling.
